page.title: 08Cupar Playground Games
page.content: Infant{children}i.e. those aged 5_7 enjoy playing such{games}as "Wolves" a similar{game}to tig. The girls play skipping ,the boys enjoy "pretend" fighting during their{school {recreation}time. At this age boys and girls will play together and much time is spent playing imaginary{games prompted by the previous night's television, or books they have been reading. Sometimes toys are brought to school and the{children}put less emphasis on specific{games,}preferring to make up{games}on the spur of the moment. Nursery or pre_school{children}are always supervised and their playground activites revolve around equipment such as climbing frames and swings. In good weather many enjoy playing on the grass. In both the infant and nursery groups there are no seasonal changes.
